CatDescriptText: An official with the Pittsburgh Urban League in 1940s and 1950s,  Irvis became the first African American to be elected to the Pennsylvania House of Representatives in 1958.  He was re-elected to that seat for 15 consecutive terms.  Irvis is currently the Distinguished Presidential Scholar at Temple University.
TitMainTitle: K. Leroy Irvis, unknown man, Ewari (Ed) Ellis wearing hat, and Fifth Avenue High School student Abdullah Ahmed (Johnny Clark), seated in room with American flag in background, for a meeting concerning Hill District improvement
